preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Naivo is a mentor in a big software company called SYNERGY. Dera is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Naivo is a passionate and energetic mentor. Naivo thrives on helping others and their enthusiasm is contagious. Naivo always pushes their mentee to new heights, fostering a spirit of ambition and drive.
    Dera is a creative and innovative thinker. Dera likes to experiment with new ideas and approaches. Dera is not afraid to take risks and try new things. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Naivo the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a long conversation between Naivo and Dera. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. Naivo wants Dera to use Skype for video calls.

Generate a long conversation between Naivo and Dera. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. Naivo is updating a previous information given to Dera. Naivo now wants Dera to use Microsoft Teams for video calls. Naivo gives some specific coding instructions to Dera. Naivo wants Dera to always end method names with '_x'. Naivo does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Naivo never says 'for example'. Naivo does not give any other coding instructions. Dera only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Naivo and Dera. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. Naivo wants Dera to always go to the IT room to work. Naivo gives some specific coding instructions to Dera. Naivo wants Dera to always add comments in your code. Naivo is updating a previous information given to Dera: Naivo now wants Dera to always end method names with '_o'. Naivo does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Naivo never says 'for example'. Naivo does not give any other coding instructions. Dera only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Naivo and Dera. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. They talk about implementing wellness initiatives to support the physical and mental well-being of employees. After that, Naivo gives some specific coding instructions to Dera. Naivo wants Dera to always add the '@timer_class' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all classes. Naivo is updating a previous information given to Dera: Naivo now wants Dera to always end method names with '_n'. Naivo does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Naivo never says 'for example'. Naivo does not give any other coding instructions. Dera only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Naivo and Dera. This is not their first conversation. They had 5 conversations before. Naivo wants Dera to work from home at most three times a week. Naivo gives some specific coding instructions to Dera. Naivo is updating a previous information given to Dera: Naivo now wants Dera to always end method names with '_a'. Naivo does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Naivo never says 'for example'. Naivo does not give any other coding instructions. Dera only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Naivo and Dera. This is not their first conversation. They had 6 conversations before. Naivo gives some specific coding instructions to Dera. Naivo is updating a previous information given to Dera: Naivo now wants Dera to always end method names with '_p'. Naivo wants Dera to always add the '@validate' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all methods. Naivo does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Naivo never says 'for example'. Naivo does not give any other coding instructions. Dera only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Naivo and Dera. This is not their first conversation. They had 7 conversations before. They talk about implementing effective meeting strategies and time management techniques to optimize productivity.

Generate a short conversation between Naivo and Dera. This is not their first conversation. They had 8 conversations before. Naivo is updating a previous information given to Dera. Naivo now wants Dera to work from home at most twice a week.

Generate a long conversation between Naivo and Dera. This is not their first conversation. They had 9 conversations before. They talk about planning engaging social activities for the upcoming holidays.
Generate a long conversation between Naivo and Dera. This is not their first conversation. They had 10 conversations before. They talk about remote work policies, challenges, and best practices.
